alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:59PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 630 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles east of Lake De Smet, which is also 19 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain of around on-half inch and pea sized hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid water runoff in ditches and draws. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Johnson County. The heaviest rain was falling between Double Cross Road and Thompson Creek Road in extreme northeast Johnson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
